CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 02-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Elser oe: are aH 2014/KER/201 CrLMC.No. 5 of 2014 ( APPENDIX PETITIONER(S) EXHIBITS : ANNX.A1 - THE TRUE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.359/2011 OF KASARAGOD POLICE STATION. ANNX.A2 - THE TRUE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.359/2011 OF KASARAGOD POLICE STATION. ANNX.A3 - THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 22-10-2013 SWORN IN BY THE 1ST RESPONDENT. RESPONDENT(S)' EXHIBITS : NIL /TRUE COPY/ PATO JUDGE AV an HARUN-UL-RASHID, J. 2014/KER/201 Dated this the 2" day of January, 2014 ORDER Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and respondents. 2. Accused Nos.1 & 2 in Crime No.359/2011 of the Kasaragod Police Station now pending as C.C.No.374/2013 before the Chief Judicial Magistrate Court, Kasaragod are the petitioners. The petition is filed seeking to quash further proceedings against the petitioners in C.C.No.374/2013 on the file of the Chief Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kasaragod. 3. The offences alleged are punishable under Sections 498(A), 323, 324 read with Section 34 of IPC. 4. The learned counsel on both sides submit that the dispute between the parties have been amicably settled and having regard to the resolution of the disputes between the parties, continuance of the criminal prosecution against the petitioners is an avoidable irritant. In view of the settlement arrived at between the parties, the Cri.M.C is disposed of quashing further proceedings against the petitioners in C.C.No.374/2013 on the file of the Chief Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kasaragod. Sd/- HARUN-UL-RASHID, JUDGE. AV
